poem:
The Rhythm of Bill  

In the halls of learning,  
Bill strummed wisdom on strings,  
headteacher by day,  
by night, a melody maker.  
With chords of Manchester skies,  
he played the road,  
round the pier into hearts,  
a song forever echoing,  
in the dance of the Rhythm Sisters,  
leaving us to hum his tune.
